Line 397: Line 397:
==Tourism==
==Tourism==
{{Main|Tourism in Kerala}}
{{Main|Tourism in Kerala}}
â
[[Image:Kerala God's Own Country Logo.svg|thumb|200px|right|The official logo of Kerala Tourism]]
 
[[Image:KovalamBeach.JPG|thumb|right|200px|Kovalam beach, [[Thiruvananthapuram|Trivandrum]]]]
[[Image:KovalamBeach.JPG|thumb|right|200px|Kovalam beach, [[Thiruvananthapuram|Trivandrum]]]]
Kerala is situated on the lush and tropical [[Malabar Coast]]. Kerala is one of the most popular{{Weasel-inline|date=May 2011}} tourist destinations in India. Its unique{{Peacock term|date=May 2011}} [[culture of Kerala|culture and traditions]], coupled with its varied [[demographics of Kerala|demographics]], has made Kerala one of the most popular tourist destinations in the world. [[National Geographic]]'s [[National Geographic Traveler|Traveller]] magazine names Kerala as one of the "ten paradises of the world" and "50 must see destinations of a lifetime". [[Travel and Leisure]] names Kerala as "One of the 100 great trips for the 21st century".<ref>{{Cite news |author= |title=Kerala : National Geographic Traveler selects Kerala as âone of the 50 must see destinations of a lifetimeâ |publisher=Travel Portal of India|date=27 January 2009 |accessdate=11 June 2011 |url=http://www.travelportalofindia.com/2009/07/kerala-national-geographic-traveler-selects-kerala-as-one-of-the-50-must-see-destinations-of-a-lifetime/}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |author= |title=Kerala - God's Own Country|publisher=Kerala Homestays|date=27 January 2009 |accessdate=11 June 2011 |url=http://www.keralahomestaysonline.com/main/kerala.asp}}</ref>
